title: Week in Pictures: 9/11 tribute, Surf Dog competition, back-to-school
text:
ABC News photo editors chose the best news images of the week for this collection. </br></br>Alexandra Hamatie, whose cousin Robert Horohoe was killed on September 11, pauses at the National September 11 Memorial during a morning commemoration ceremony for the victims of the terrorist attacks, Sept. 11, 2019, in New York City. Spencer Platt/Getty Images

Ebony Thomas looks at her phone a she sits on a sofa inside her shattered home, in the aftermath of Hurricane Dorian, in Mclean's Town, Grand Bahama, Bahamas, Sept. 11, 2019. The 15-year-old lost three family members to the Hurricane. Ramon Espinosa/AP

A small airplane crashed into the Ak-Chin Regional Airport main building in Maricopa, Ariz., Sept. 10, 2019. Tom Tingle/The Arizona Republic via USA Today Network

A dog tries to stay on his surfboard while competing at the 14th annual Helen Woodward Animal Center "Surf-A-Thon" in which more than 70 dogs competed in five different weight classes for "Top Surf Dog 2019" in Del Mar, Calif., Sept. 8, 2019. Mike Blake/Reuters

Jiang Tongying plays games with children at the Hua'ao primary school in Jianhe, China, Sept. 5, 2019. Jiang Tongying is a 56-year-old teacher who has been working at the school since 1982. Yang Wenbin/Newscom

University freshmen practice folding quilts during a military education and training session on a university campus in Yangzhou, China, Sept. 6, 2019. via AFP/Getty Images

A police officer holds up pepper spray as he attempts to disperse protesters from a platform at Po Lam Station, Sept. 5, 2019, in Hong Kong. Pro-democracy protesters have continued demonstrations across Hong Kong against a controversial bill that would allow extraditions to mainland China. Anthony Kwan/Getty Images

Antonio Vera, a reveler depicting the figure of Cascamorras, is surrounded by others as they take part in the annual Cascamorras festival in Baza, Spain, Sept. 6, 2019. Jon Nazca/Reuters

Rafael Nadal, of Spain, reacts after defeating Daniil Medvedev, of Russia, to win the men's singles final of the U.S. Open tennis championships, Sept. 8, 2019, in New York. Sarah Stier/AP

Amputee soccer players line up before a friendly match between Ukrainian and Azeri teams in Kiev, Ukraine, Sept. 11, 2019. Valentyn Ogirenko/Reuters

U.S. Border Patrol agents search people suspected of crossing the Rio Grande River to enter the United States illegally near McAllen, Texas, Sept. 11, 2019. Larry W Smith/EPA via Rex
description: Find this week's top photos from around the globe in ABC News' This Week in Pictures slideshow
